intro: Leptochilus latifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf leptochilus, is a flowering plant belonging to the familyApiaceae. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense colonies. The plant is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
